content.text:
# Lupinus kingii

|status_system = TNC
|status_ref =
|genus = Lupinus
|species = kingii
|authority = S. Watson
|synonyms =
*Lupinus argillaceus Wooton & Standley
}}
Lupinus kingii ('''King's lupine''') is a species of Lupinus, family Fabaceae, which can be found in Arizona, Colorado, Nevada, New Mexico, Utah. Both the leaves and the pods are hairy with the later being  long. In Utah, it is found only at Bryce Canyon National Park.
References
External links
*[http://www.nazflora.org/Lupinus_kingii.htm Photos of Lupinus kingii which were taken in Flagstaff, Arizona]
